Comparison of COVID: 19 deaths to Vietnam War deaths: The expert compared the number of COVID-19 deaths in the U.S. to the number of American deaths in the Vietnam War, highlighting that the former will be more than double the latter by fall 2020.
Reference to official sources: The expert cited the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) as a source for the provisional count of COVID-19 deaths in the U.S. on July 24, 2020. They also mentioned the John Hopkins University count as an alternative source.
Analysis of existing data: The expert analyzed the available data on COVID-19 deaths and compared it to the number of American deaths recorded for the Vietnam War, providing specific figures and highlighting the difference.
Mention of expert forecasts: The expert referred to the CDC's forecasts on the total number of COVID-19 deaths, indicating that their estimates only go up to mid-August. They also mentioned that the CDC estimated a range of "between 160,000 and 175,000 total reported COVID-19 deaths by August 15" based on assessments from various organizations.
